These three additional power tiles are added to those available at the beginning of the game.

They have the distinction of being 2 colors. The players need the pyramids of both colors at the correct level to be able to buy them.

Divine Prescience (red/blue): Your opponent must reveal the Divine Intervention cards he will play during a battle, before you choose your Battle and Divine Intervention cards. If your opponent has the Prescience blue tile, the revelation of your Battle card and his DivineIntervention cards are done simultaneously.

Renewal (white/red): During the night phase, before the new Divine Intervention cards are dealt, discard as many Divine Intervention cards as you want and draw the same number plus one.

Disciple of Ptah (blue/white): Each pyramid you control gives you a temporary VP at level 3 instead of level 4.
207149.name: Kemet: Dice Tower Promo 2016

207150.name: Room 25: Dice Tower Promo 2016
207150.description:
A new room tile which was originally available as a reward in the 2016 Dice Tower Season 12 Kickstarter.

Mr. Tom's Hall (Green Room)

Tom is neither a guard nor a prisoner, he’s a games fan and therefore a guest on the show. When you enter the room, if you give your reminder token (by discarding it permanently), you may immediately choose between seeing a hidden adjacent room, or being pushed into an adjacent room. If you refuse to give your reminder token or if you don’t have it anymore, he pushes you into an adjacent room chosen by the first player of the turn (it can be yourself).

Note: You can’t use this room in Madness mode (due to reminder tokens being absent)

History Note: Originally called Uncle Tom's Hall, but changed Room 25 publisher Matagot (a French company) once they learned of the meaning of "Uncle Tom" in America.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/tomvasel/the-dice-tower...

207151.name: One Page Dungeon Compendium: 2012 Edition
207151.description:
User summary:

This compendium gathers and presents every dungeon submitted to the annual "one page dungeon" competition for 2012. Each page presents a stand-alone dungeon, complete with map (or alternative) and description. Dungeons are system neutral but generally compatible with "old school" fantasy games. The introductory materials also note the winners in numerous categories.

207152.name: Yume Kagura
207152.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game select a race, then distribute a point pool into Attributes (Mind, Tech, Body, and Spirit). A variety of derived values are calculated. Skills are then selected and a separate point pool is distributed into them. Skills are tied back to an Attribute for performance bonuses. Character creation ends with selecting personal equipment.

Characters in the game generally try to prevent other people (victims) from being possessed by spirit powers. Possessed people can assume the forms of sex-morphing monsters and then engage in indiscriminate rape of others. The game features heavy "erotic" (e.g., rape) themes.

This strange game is distributed as a ZIP archive containing a variety of ASCII text files, organized somewhat topically. Accessing the entire game is difficult and requires using several files simultaneously (organization is poor). Written in Japanese, an English translation also exists.

207153.name: A Call for Heroes
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
207153.description:
From the introduction:

A Call for Heroes is an adventure for the Star Wars: The Force Awakens Beginner game. It is designed to follow the events of Discovery on Jakku, the Beginner game’s adventure.
Since the events of Discovery on Jakku, the Player Characters (PCs) have likely made contact with the Resistance and joined the struggle against the First Order. At the very least, they now have good reasons to resent the rising power of this new state, even if they were not able to reach the Resistance. In A Call for Heroes, the PCs can follow up on the events of Discovery on Jakku and strike out against the newly revealed oppressors.

207154.name: Hooligan Vasja
207154.description:
User Summary

Hoolijan Vasja is a casual game with cartoon graphics. You are a hooligan boy who is running up a downspout shooting at cats and grannies who are trying to hit you. Once on the roof you face a boss.

207155.name: Firebird - La Peri
videogamehonor: 2016 Proto Awards Best Art Direction of the Year Winner
2016 Proto Awards Most Innovative Game of the Year Nominee
207155.description:
La Péri” is a VR experience based on classical music and ballet by composer Paul Dukas

Source: The Developer Website.

207156.name: Superfight: The Orange Deck 2
207156.description: Orange Deck 2 boldly goes where no Orange deck has gone before. With 100 new cards from your favorite nerdy books, movies, comics, and TV shows, your deck will be shiny and chrome all the way to Valhalla.

207157.name: Fantasy Tome of Lists
207157.description:
This book is filled with lists that will add flavor and excitement to your fantasy campaigns.

This book is designed to provide ideas and adventure hooks for any fantasy roleplaying game. This lists are designed to help make a fantasy campaign more interesting and to fill it with rich details and unique color. These 84 lists range from encounters of every known environment to different varieties of the most popular monsters.

- Publisher's description

207158.name: Fantasy Tome of Lists 2
207158.description:
This book is another powerful resource of fantasy lists that will enhance any fantasy RPG experience.

This book is designed to provide ideas and adventure hooks for any fantasy roleplaying game. This lists are designed to help make a fantasy campaign more interesting and to fill it with rich details and unique color. These 96 lists range from name generators from popular ancient cultures to more spells and magic items.

- Publisher's description

207159.name: Highest Bidder
207159.description:
Highest Bidder is a card game for 2-5 players. Bidding is a central mechanism as players place secret bids from their hands onto point-scoring cards. Bids are placed simultaneously at the count of three and you never know which cards, how many and in which order your opponents will play.

Once bids are placed face down in front of each player, they're revealed one card at a time. Numbered "Bid Cards" add toward the value of your bid. Strategic "Effect Cards" affect your opponents.

The player with the most points once all cards have been bid on, wins.

207160.name: Schwarzbart
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
207160.description:
User Summary:

In Schwarzbart (Blackbeard) the adventurers are on the hunt for the notorious pirate Schwarzbart. On the hunt they strand on an island ruled by a clan of cannibals.
On the island they find a treasure map, showing the way to the sunken city of Celastia, before beeing rescued by Schwarzbart.
Together pirates and adventureres set out to find and explore the city, its incredible wealth and magic. And an old curse lying on the city of Celastia.
In the end the adventurers end up in the middle of a nightmare of tormented undead, fiery chaos and angry demons.

207161.name: Ultimate Word Search 2: Letter Boxed
207161.description:
Step into a world of mystery and solve hidden 3D word challenges.

Source: The Game Website.

207162.name: Fantastic Checkers 2
207162.description:
Popular checkers game with 3D boards and 3D monsters! Includes 2-player mode.

Source: The Developer Website.

207163.name: Fantastic 4 In A Row 2
207163.description:
Check out a 3D version of the classic game support for up to 4 players on multi-sided boards.

Source: The Developer Website.

207164.name: Barnyard Mahjong 3
207164.description:
Farm-Themed mahjong in 3D with entertaining animal sounds and many puzzle layouts.

Source: The Developer Website.

207165.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 272 - Apr 1998)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (1st Edition)

207166.name: hocus
207166.description:
perspective illusion puzzle based on M.C. Escher drawings and impossible...

Source: The Game Website.

207167.name: Monopoly: Ultimate Banking
207167.description:
Fast-paced version of the classic property trading game featuring the "ultimate banking unit" that keeps track players' wealth and properties.

Property values rise and fall based on how many times they're landed on and the effects of new Event cards.

The game concludes when one player goes bankrupt. At the point, the banking unit tabulates players' wealth and the one with the highest total of cash and assets wins the game!

207168.description:
Game description from the designer:

Procurado: Mosquito da Dengue is a game for up to 4 players. It is a cooperative game where the goal of the players is to eliminate all breeding sites of the mosquito Aedes aegypti or eliminate all the mosquitoes in the game. Mosquito wins all players are able to eliminate all members of a single family (There are 4 families in the game). For this the players will have to roll 3 Dice D6 and position them in only 3 of the 5 existing on the board records. The value obtained in the Dice D6, indicate how many points each disc can spin, always clockwise. With the rotation of these disks, there will always combinations of two symbols that trigger actions immediately. Are nine possible combinations of actions and players will need to know very well where to place each data in order to fulfill the goal of the game.
207168.name: Procurado: Mosquito da Dengue !

207172.name: Mahjong Deluxe 3
207172.description:
Mahjong Deluxe 3 is the newest entry in the popular Mahjong series of casual games produced by award-winning game developer EnsenaSoft. With more than 15 million downloads across versions, the blockbuster series of Mahjong Deluxe continues to impress with its ease of use, intuitive controls and family-friendly features and content.

Source: The Game Website.

207173.name: Mini Golf Mundo
207173.description:
18 holes of mini-golf with realistic physics and 2 great courses full of fun.

Source: The Developer Website.

207174.name: ABC Coloring Town
207174.description:
Educational interactive coloring book featuring wonderfully designed fantasy village.

Source: The Developer Website.

207175.name: Ludo Supremo
207175.description:
A fun dice and board game for 2 to 4 players or AIs, in which they race their tokens from start to finish.

Source: The Game Website.

207176.name: Puzzles Under The Hill
207176.description:
Pamela Possum is going to take a little walk. Help her meet up with her best friend, Sammy Squirrel, by solving these beautiful jigsaw puzzles created using digital images from the National Gallery of Art.

Source: The Game Website.

207177.name: Bayla Bunny
207177.description:
Bayla Bunny has lots of energy and once she starts going she seldom stops. When she finds a book full of maps to magical treasures, she sets out on a journey to find them all. In this exhilarating platformer game you get to help her hop, run, jump, bounce, duck, swing, rocket and ride through 27 different courses as she collects coins, finds the keys and unlocks the treasure chests.

Source: The Game Website.

207178.name: Puzzles At Mystery Manor
207178.description:
Solve the mystery by finding the skulls hidden in jigsaw puzzles throughout manor.

Source: The Game Website.

207179.name: Mahjong Destiny
207179.description:
Join a maiden on her 3D quest of destiny with 74 puzzles ranging from 25 up to over 300 tiles to match.

Source: The Developer Website.

207180.name: Kitty Cat: Jigsaw Puzzles
207180.description:
MEOW! If you love cats, this is the jigsaw puzzle game for you! Solve 84 jigsaw puzzles of cute little kittens.

Source: The Developer Website.

207181.name: Puppy Dog: Jigsaw Puzzles
207181.description:
Have fun playing through 84 puzzles of lovely little puppies and dogs.

Source: The Developer Website.

207182.name: Hell Comes to Frogtown
207182.description:
User summary:

The game is an adaptation of the eponymous science fiction B-movie, with various riffs from similar movies thrown in for good measure. The basic system uses three dice of any type but different color (black, white, red preferred). Rolls have a variety of interpretations based on interrelated results.

Depending upon the group approach, the game can be played as peculiar post-apocalypse science fiction or as a farcical comedy.

207183.name: Drool, You Idiots!
207183.description:
A generic supplement for all cyberpunkish roleplaying systems

User summary:

This supplement provides a grab-bag of topics that might be useful for any cyberpunk style game. Each topic is presented as a standalone essay or article. Areas covered include Celtic Folklore, Sidhe, Fairies, Nanotech, Bioware, Implants, Chipware, Technological Warfare, Counter Terrorism, and numerous items of equipment.

207184.name: My First Animal Tower
207184.description: Fisher-Price animal stacking dexterity challenge. Little kids version of Animal Upon Animal. 6 Big chunky animal pieces and 1 large wooden die included in the game. Roll the die until an unstacked animal is shown, try to stack the animal shown . Everyone wins if the stack is complete. Person who knocks over the stack is the loser. For an extra challenge, try stacking the die on top of the animals for a finishing touch!

207185.name: Sideline Football
207185.description: SIDELINE FOOTBALL by FTP Sports Games is a full simulation of the game of Professional or College football. The game engine is designed around an individual player's ability or inability to win battles or one-on-one matchups. Each play from scrimmage calls on one or more players to make a play that will influence the result. Offensive players will block, read defenses, read holes, get open, pass, catch and run, all in an attempt to make a positive play for the offense. Defensive players will play the run, tackle, hit, rush the passer, sack the passer, defend pass routes, intercept the ball and force fumbles all in an attempt to make a positive play for the defense. The task(s) on each play and the player(s) involved are determined by a GAME CENTER Chart which serves as the centerpiece for game play. A double-sided Play Result Card deck is used in conjunction with the GAME CENTER to determine who is involved on the play and what the result of the play is. Nearly all plays from scrimmage come from the Play Result Deck, GAME CENTER Chart and individual player cards. Long Gains, Special Teams, Trick Plays, Turnovers and Injuries get their results from a series of supplemental charts. On any given play, an offensive player, defensive player or a combination of the two can influence the result. This gives each individual game a full flavor of the quality of the players from both teams as each individual player will be involved in many play results.

207186.description:
The bankers just received a call from the police of the Greenwick District. It appears there are robbers disguised as bankers for months now and are planning to rob the bank today!Will the banker stop the robbers in time, or allow the robbers escape freely with all the hard earned money from the citizens of Greenwick District.Bankers and Robbers is a social and logical deduction card game for 5-8 players, takes up to 30 minutes of game time and is suitable for players age 14 and above.The game is split into 2 phases.

(Phase 1) Each player will be given a character card. Each player will either be playing the role of a banker or a robber.In every game there will only be 2 robbers and the remaining players will all be bankers. Each player will be assigned a number from 1-8 and will take turns taking a number token from the token bag. Each player will be able to perform 1 of 2 actions to the player shown by the number token.They can either give the player a gun card or a key card.The turn sequence continues until the the end of every third round, whereby there will be a swap action performed.Any player to receive 3 gun cards will be immediately eliminated from the game.A Robber player can choose to use 2 key cards to reveal an identity of another player holding 2 key cards.Any player can choose to use 3 key cards to take a peek at a players card of his or her choice(if the role of the chosen player differs from their own character,take a gun card).Any player can choose to use 4 key cards to reveal a chosen players card to the public.Any player to receive 5 key cards will need to immediately discard all their key cards and gun cards.

(Phase 2) Each player will need to race from the start to the end. The player who reach the end point first will win the game.Each player moves by either choosing to use a move step card or by rolling a dice. At the end of the round,only 1 player will be shot for being behind another player from the opposing team.A banker player will be eliminated by receiving 3 gun cards in phase 2 of the game.A robber player will be eliminated by receiving 6 gun cards in phase 2 of the game.Key cards will act as gun cards in phase 2 of the game.

The bankers goal in phase 1 is to eliminate all robber players before they manage to escape to phase 2 of the game,hence win the game.The robbers goal in phase 1 is to find his or her partner by performing a reveal on another player and if successful, both robber players will escape to phase 2 of the game.The bankers and robbers goal in phase 2 is to have any player from their team reach to the end point first before the opposing team or to eliminate all players from the opposing team.Whichever team completes phase 2 first will win the game.
207186.name: Bankers and Robbers

207187.name: Flipolo
207187.description:
Arrange your animal tiles as fast as you can! No time to think! No time to waste! Speed is of the essence!
12 animal tiles and one game board. Sounds simple? You’ll be surprised! All tiles are double sided! you must flip and switch then switch and flip until all tiles are in place.
Challenge yourself! Join the frantic race!

207188.name: Mahjong Deluxe 2: Astral Planes
207188.description:
Super cool 3D version of classic Chinese solitaire with different environments and exciting puzzles.

Source: The Developer Website.

207189.name: Fabulous Food Truck
207189.description:
An exciting time-management arcade game testing your skills as the cook of a busy food truck.

Source: The Developer Website.

207190.name: Mystery Of Rivenhallows
207190.description:
An exciting point-and-click adventure game full of mystery and suspense.

Source: The Developer Website.

207191.name: OneDice WW2: Achtung - Commando!
207191.description:
From publisher blurb:

Three missions in Nazi-occupied France form a mini-campaign for the intrepid men of 64 Commando in the darkest days of WW2. Whether you're destroying a radar station, rescuing an SOE agent or reconnoitering a V1 rocket base, it's action all the way!

207192.name: Affiliation Guide #1
207192.description:
From publisher blurb:

The secrets of the world’s first AMP Affiliations are revealed inside. The Seekers of Enlightenment, The Changelings, Typhoon and The United Human Front (UHF) couldn’t be more different from each other, but each group brings their own unique powers and abilities to coming war.

Inside Affiliation Guide #1, you’ll discover:

Changelings

Includes:

Breakdown on Changeling hierarchy and info on available safehouses
New Powers: Atavism and Secretions
Complete adventure: Heller Highwater





Seekers of Enlightenment

Includes:

Breakdown on Seeker recruitment and what it’s like to be a Seeker
New Universal Powers: Kinship and Martial Arts
Complete adventure: Tone, Treble, Trouble





Typhoon

Includes:

A look at what it means to be in the higher ranks of Typhoon
New Gifts, Drawbacks and even a new Drug: Chillax
New Power: Juicer
Complete adventure: Due South





United Human Front

Includes:

What is it like to be member of the UHF?
New UHF-Only Power: Genetic Tampering
Complete adventure: Dark or Light

207193.name: Five Swords (II)
207193.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need some great magic items for your Pathfinder game? Avalon Games is here to help! Each issue of the Avalon’s Mystic Treasures series will focus on five new magical items for any Pathfinder games. Each item comes with a full description, powers, and cost, as well as history and adventure hooks. All you need to do is drop them into your game and watch your players squeal with delight.

207194.name: Government Worker
207194.description:
Simple 2-8 player card game with two separate decks that will comprise a players hand or cards immediately played - the "Work" deck and the "Draw" deck. The red Work cards cards adds hours worked to your hand. The Draw deck is split between blue "Dick Off" cards that subtract hours worked to your hand and green cards that are played (read) immediately, then discarded.

Each round, players receive four Work cards, then, in turn order, they draw a card from the Draw deck until a "Time Cards Due" card is revealed. As players draw cards from the Draw deck they either read and immediately play the green cards or add to their hand the blue "Dick Off" cards. Once the "Time Cards Due" is drawn, the round ends and players add their "Work" card hours and subtract their "Dick Off" card hours for their net score. Play continues over a series of rounds (determined by the players) with the player with the lowest number of hours worked declared the winner.

207195.name: Heroes Weekly (Vol 6, Issue 7 - Boost Powers)
207195.description:
From publisher blurb:

Packed full of great superhero fun, each issue offers a short adventure, an NPC, or some game mechanics for the Heroes Wear Masks system. While compatible with the HWM system, you can always use the information presented in each issue for other superhero games—just monkey around with the stats and mechanics to fit the system you are using.

This Week we have a new power type, Boost!

207196.name: Top Flopp
207196.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Top Flopp is a fun trick-taking card game for the whole family. For 2 - 8 players. Aged 10+.

There are three ways to start the game. Based on your cards, you decide and call whether you play: TOP, FLOPP or Chance. If you call TOP you must win each round and all other players will try to trump whereas in a FLOPP round you must lose each round and all other players will try not to trump. If you win a TOP or FLOPP you gain points but if you lose all others get points. When calling Chance you just play a card, which can be trumped or not and everyone has the chance to gain points. The player who trumped then gets to call TOP, FLOPP or Chance… The player who reached the winning amount of points (depending on the number of players) wins the game.

Playing time varies depending on the number of players or the amount of winning points you decide on. reviewers and testplayers played from 15 minutes up to 5 hours (with many rounds and special self-invented challenges for winners or losers ;-).

Reviewers and testplayers say Top Flopp is similar to Swiss/German/Austrian traditional card games like Jassen, Schnellen, Schnalzen... and is most fun with 3 or 4 players.

207197.name: Spaß muß sein!
207197.description:
The German title of the game Spaß muß sein! means "Fun must be!”. This is a simple card game, printed 1958. The game includes 100 cards of two types. The blue one with a ques-tion, and the red one with a answer. You have to through a card with a question. A other player has to choose answer. It’s up to you to decide if the answer is fitting or just fun.
Example: Question: “Would you like to go with me trough a forest?” Answer: “No, its to dan-gerous.”

207198.name: Acan's Call: Act 1
207198.description:
User Summary

Acan's Call is a sword fighting game made for VR.

207199.name: Ride 2
207199.description:
Over 200 bikes!
Collect them all to create your own personal garage, choosing from the most powerful and iconic categories and models (like the Nakeds and the Supersports).

Source: The Game Website.

207200.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The Cows are back, and this time they brought some back up! Swine Fu add all new creatures, and new Kung Fu event cards you can use to "Up the Steaks".

With 3 new survivors, 3 more locations, and all new items, the steaks just got higher. Take down the Sow-lin Monk, and watch out for the Ham-urai.

Master the art of Kung Fu to draw more cards and add a little Bacon to your hand.
207200.name: Shoot Cows 2: Swine Fu!

207201.name: Rhyme: The Rap Challenge
207201.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Rhyme: The Rap Challenge is a unique, entertaining party game for the whole family that gives you the chance to discover the rapper in you! Things are simple – choose words from different categories, write your own verses on any subject (as long as they rhyme), rap them on the beat, and collect points. At the end of four rounds you will have created your masterpiece: your 16-bar rap song! The player who accumulates the most points wins.

In Rhyme: The Rap Challenge players are aspiring rappers competing to find out who can create the best rap song.
In order to do that, players have 4 rounds in which they must write 4 verses – 1 in each round. As this is a rap song the 4 bars in each verse must rhyme.
Each round players must draw 3 cards from 1, 2, or 3 of the different categories in front of them and choose 1 word from each card – 3 words in total. They have to use those words in order to create their verse in 3 minutes time.
In the first round that might seem quite easy as they can write about anything they wish – which will probably be funny anyway.
The real fun begins after the first round because players have to choose 3 new words from different categories on each successive round and use them to create their 2nd, 3rd and 4th verses while trying to keep a thematic cohesion with the first verse – they are writing a song after all.
This is easier said than done as the categories do not match between them e.g. pirates, purse, body, house, football, fairy tales, farm and more, so things get easily out of hand resulting in lots of fun and laughter from the verses created.
The best part though is that in the end of each round players will have to rap their verse on one of the beats, which will be available to choose from the game’s website. Then players will vote, by simultaneously pointing at the player with the best verse in their opinion.
Scoring - Each round players have the ability to gain points as follows:
1 point for each word that was used in the verse,
3 point, instead of the 1 above, for each word that was used to rhyme,
1 point for the player who finished first each round,
1 point for each vote for the best verse, at the end of the 1st, 2nd and 3rd round.
At the end of the 4th round players will rap their whole song and then have the final voting for the best song. The player with the most votes scores 3 points.
When the 4 rounds are over the player with the most points is the winner.

207202.name: Castle Dukes
207202.description:
As a duke, you have decided to build the greatest castle in the land. You are not the only Duke in this land, though, and you are not the only one with this fantastic ambition.

There are many ways to build your castle. You can even build it to lean towards one of several different styles, be it for Defence, for Comfort or even for Offence!

The occasional royalty may pop by your land and if your castle does not suit his or her taste, they will leave to find better accommodations with your rival dukes! On top of that, the deadly dragon will appear once in awhile and raze the lands. If your castle is not well fortified against dragon attacks, it might just crumble! Score Victory Points (VP) by having the most number of important folks residing in your castle, as well as have the most magnificent castle of all and take home the title of Grand Duke! Castle Dukes is a very visually appealing game of Dexterity and Strategy - And it's 3D to boot!

Each round, players start with 5 Coins. 6 Room cards are revealed from the stack and placed in positions 1 through 6 (from bottom to top), each room costing a higher amount of Coins to acquire than the last. The player with the First Player token gets first rights to the Room cards, passing the turn in clockwise direction until all players have had their chance to acquire rooms with their Coins. Rooms acquired leave a gap on their position and are not replaced with new cards during any player's turn. At the end of the whole turn after every player has had a chance at the rooms, any remaining room cards are then moved downwards to fill any gaps. Draw more Room cards from the Room Stack to fill all positions as needed. It is possible to choose not to acquire any Room card during a player's turn. Note: In the various positions 1 through 6, players also acquire additional castle components such as Tables and Coffers along with the Room cards, as depicted on the position on the main game board.

Once done, all players then simultaneously acquire pillars, Floor Tiles, and Construction cards using their remaining Coins. They may then immediately build the newly acquired components, adding on layers to their castles until they gradually become beautiful fortresses of various shapes and heights. When all players are done with this next phase, a Guest card is revealed to show which Guests have dropped by for that turn. The princess always goes for the most comfortable castle, even if its flimsy. The king's life is very precious and he always seeks out the most defended castle. The knight looks for glory and always goes for the castle that best gives him the chance to slay a dragon. This is the end of a turn in Castle Dukes. The First Player token is now passed on to the right, and a new turn begins with each player having 5 Coins again. And yes, a dragon might appear now and then to attack all castles! Depending on your level of Defence or Offence, each castle will take varying amounts of damage.

Beware! This is also a dexterity game! If at any point in the game your castle collapses, be it a small portion or even just one tiny component falling off, you will take a Crumble token which at the end of the game reduces your Victory Points by 2!

207203.description:
Description from the publisher:

War Titans is the first Crawling Chaos Games project: a cooperative game in which players face hordes of Invaders. Each player is given the role of a Pilot with unique characteristics, who has been assigned to one of the mighty Titans, huge combat robots able to face the menace of gigantic monsters and save humankind from extinction!

The structure of the game is based on the greatest anime series and manga sagas which have originally inspired our game designers. Every turn is an Episode, during every Episode human cities are attacked by horrible monsters sent on earth by cruel Tyrants through dimensional Rifts. The main objective of the game is to defeat the Tyrants, close those Rifts and to kill as many creatures as possible without destroying the planet in the process! Only once the Tyrants have been defeated, the Players of War Titans: Invaders Must Die, will have the chance to uncover the Final Episode card, complete a last epic mission and thus finally free the children of men!
207203.name: War Titans: Invaders Must Die!
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 69: Tuesday, September 27th

207204.name: The God's Chain
207204.description:
Finally the day came when we found our GOD.Human Beings are an experiment done by them.The human beings are evolving and have become one of the greatest powers in the universe which is becoming a great problem for other colonies in the universe.

Source: The Game Website.

207205.name: The VR Museum of Fine Art
207205.description:
he VR Museum of Fine Art, Steam’s premiere VR educational experience. Explore 15 high-fidelity sculptures ranging from Michelangelo’s Pieta to the gigantic Great Buddha. Available this Friday, Free to Play.

Source: The Developer Website.

207206.name: Wish -tale of the sixteenth night of lunar month-
207206.description:
User Summary

Wish is a japanese doujin game visual novel made by Migiha.

207207.description: Glüx is a family game all about illuminating rooms. Every player tries to play the brightest light tokens in different areas on the board, thus gaining the majority in those areas. Who can place their light tokens in the cleverest way and illuminate the most areas?
207207.name: Glüx
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG 18: Kris Burm & Vooruitblik 2017

207208.description:
In a post-apocalyptic world, players try to rebuild society. Using the debris, they build new towns for the remaining survivors to live in — but these friendly folks aren't the only ones still out there. Marauders want to pillage your town and see it burn. Scavenge what you can and build new structures to help you defend against the marauder threat. While you can get more things done in town when you house more survivors there, they all have to have a space to sleep or they might turn against you and join the marauders.

Armageddon is a strategy game that offers many tactical choices and different strategies to claim victory.
207208.name: Armageddon
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 70 - Spiel 2016 Treasure Hunt Part 1

207209.name: The Undercroft (Issue 10 - Aug 2016)
207209.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #10 of the quarterly zine "The Undercroft". Compatible with Lamentations of the Flame Princess and most versions of Dungeons & Dragons.

Contents

Babel Square
A bazaar and its peculiar clientele, ready to be implanted in to your game

[void]
A darkness and the kingdom who coveted it

A Miscellany
Snippets and shreds of items and people, spread them willy-nilly

The Officers’ Rest
A short location of interest and danger, of a club and its environs which previously entertained elven submariners

207212.name: Hockey Cup
207212.description:
Hockey Cup is a game about building a hockey team. It is inspired by Baseball Highlights: 2045 by Mike Fitzgerald. It uses Games Cards system.

Hockey Cup is like watching TV highlights of hockey games. In this quick and interactive game, two coaches build their teams as they play, combining both strategy (building the team) and tactics (playing the game) without any of the downtime. During each "mini-game", each coach alternates playing six cards to simulate a full game's highlights – 3 defensive and 3 offensive actions. Whichever team wins the most mini-games in the series takes the cup!

Coaches start the game with a team, which consists of 15 1st level players. On his turn a coach sends one offensive player to make 1 trick, and the other coach sends one defensive player to prevent the trick. Next, both players may use one of their special actions. An unprevented trick leads to goal. At the end of third period, if the score is tied, they play overtime, which is followed by a penalty shootout. After every game, a coach uses 3 experience points to raise the level of his players. A 2nd level player can make 2 tricks, 3rd level - 3 tricks.

207213.description:
Tallinn: The Elders is a mini-expansion for Tallinn that consists of three large figures and stickers.

During the game, the first player to have at least five symbols of a faction on their played influence cards (and not their start card) claims the matching large figure, which doubles the associated faction total on their tower cards at the end of the game.
207213.name: Tallinn: The Elders

207214.name: Avalon Haunts 04
207214.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need something a bit scary for your game? Here’s Avalon Haunts! Each issue brings you a unique, fun, and creepy haunt to spice up your games. Drop the them just about anywhere, or build a whole game around the haunt! You will find them easy to use, fun to play, and having your games become creeping with scary fun.

This month we have another haunting tale to scare and thrill your players with.

207215.name: The War Mind
207215.description:
From publisher blurb:

The War Mind is a 20-level based class created from the psionic prestige class of the same name. It contains aspects of the fighter class and war mind prestige class.

A war mind will stand at the front lines of a battle, meting out punishment and enduring the onslaught of enemies. He excels at melee combat and uses his manifesting ability to enhance his martial prowess.

It also contains favored class bonuses for many Porphyra races and a sample character Garish Falnor, a half-ogre war mind at levels 1, 5, 10, and 15.

207216.name: Designing and Running Adventures
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
207216.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Dispatches from Raven Crowking’s Nest Volume II. Pull up a chair, set your drink near your hand, and let’s talk. That’s pretty much what this is. Chatting about games in general, and Dungeon Crawl Classics in particular.

As the name implies, Dispatches has its genesis in my blog, Raven Crowking’s Nest. Dispatches has a few advantages over the free blog versions of the same material. First off, the material has been re-edited, cleaned up, and in some cases expanded. Secondly, and perhaps most importantly, it is in print so that you can keep it on your gaming shelf. Finally, Dispatches will contain some new material as well…a “thank you” for your continued interest!

I have opinions – lots of them! – but I’m going to dispense with the “IMHO”s and “IME”s, and assume that you, the Gentle Reader, are smart enough to know that I am talking about my own opinions and experiences. And, if I am wrong in that assumption, feel free to tell me so!

This volume focuses on articles related to adventure design. Although these articles use the excellent Dungeon Crawl Classics system, the general principles are adaptable to almost any game system.

This volume includes:

Basic Adventure Design
Using the Table to Your Advantage
Advanced Adventure Design
Killing Fields
How Much is Too Much?
Working For a Living, and
Your Dungeon Crawl Classics Monster Manual

207217.name: Mage Wars: Ring of Healing Promo Card
207217.description:
This promo card was given at Gen Con 2013.

Ring of Healing

Whenever a spell cast by this Mage, or an enchantment controlled by this Mage, provides healing for an object, other than the Regenerate trait, he may increase that amount of healing by one. He may use this ability once per round. If he heals multiple object (such as with a Group Heal), he only gets the +1 bonus for one object of his choice.

207218.name: Lincoln Station Stories: Creations #1
207218.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the first in a series of products for G-Core set in Lincoln Station.
In this book you will find;

6 New Origins
1 new Hero Type
3 new Powers




These are designed to help you create new characters fit for all types of adventures..

207219.name: Wolves and Red Hoods, Oh My! (Fate Core)
207219.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Radoffs say a wolfwere has kidnapped their daughter... but is that what's really happening?

Wolves and Red Hoods, Oh My! is a Fate Core adventure for 3-6 characters. It's primarily intended to use with our Aperita Arcana: fantasy for Fate Core, but can easily be used with only the main Fate Core rulebook. It's intended for a fantasy setting, but could easily be used in Victorian horror, or any other setting where a wolfwere kidnapping a peasant's daughter makes sense! At only $1, what are you waiting for? Grab it now!

207220.name: Link Thorne: The Flying Fool
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
207220.description:
From publisher blurb:

He'll Fly Anything, Anywhere... If It's Worth His Time!

In the summer of 1947, the creative team that created Captain America, Joe Simon & Jack Kirby, took over a lackluster aviation adventure strip that had crashed-and-burned in the pages of Airboy, and turned into such an electrifying read that outshone everything else in the title.

All seven of the Flying Fool episodes from the pencils and pens of Simon & Kirby have been collected in NUELOW's Link Thorne: The Flying Fool. Each unfolds more like a movie than a comic book story, and this little-known effort shows the wide variety of genres these founding creators of the comic genre were capable, as within the framework of an adventure strip, they provide action, romance, supernatural mystery, and more.

In addition to the classic works of Simon & Kirby, Link Thorne: The Flying Fool features a complete supplement for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game that features stats for many of the characters in the stories, as well as for Jack Kirby & Joe Simon.

207221.name: Old School Treasures, Level Two
207221.description:
From publisher blurb:

From mounds of mundane coins, to items of quality, chests (including chances of being locked, trapped and housing a secret compartment) and enchanted objects, Old School Treasures, Level Two, brings your 54 cards for use with your Old School RPG’s. Print, cut, shuffle up, draw, and determine treasures while creating adventures and while you play.

207222.name: Old School Treasures, Level Three
207222.description:
From publisher blurb:

From mounds of mundane coins, to items of quality, chests (including chances of being locked, trapped and housing a secret compartment) and enchanted objects, Old School Treasures, Level Three, brings your 54 cards for use with your Old School RPG’s. Print, cut, shuffle up, draw, and determine treasures while creating adventures and while you play.

207223.name: Old School Treasures, Level Four
207223.description:
From publisher blurb:

From mounds of mundane coins, to items of quality, chests (including chances of being locked, trapped and housing a secret compartment) and enchanted objects, Old School Treasures, Level Four, brings your 54 cards for use with your Old School RPG’s. Print, cut, shuffle up, draw, and determine treasures while creating adventures and while you play.

207224.name: Old School Treasures, Level Five
207224.description:
From publisher blurb:

From mounds of mundane coins, to items of quality, chests (including chances of being locked, trapped and housing a secret compartment) and enchanted objects, Old School Treasures, Level Five, brings your 54 cards for use with your Old School RPG’s. Print, cut, shuffle up, draw, and determine treasures while creating adventures and while you play.

207225.name: Old School Treasures, Level Six
207225.description:
From publisher blurb:

From mounds of mundane coins, to items of quality, chests (including chances of being locked, trapped and housing a secret compartment) and enchanted objects, Old School Treasures, Level Six, brings your 54 cards for use with your Old School RPG’s. Print, cut, shuffle up, draw, and determine treasures while creating adventures and while you play.

207226.name: You Deserve
207226.description:
You Deserve is an horror game developed by TGA Company in collaboration with Matias Aguilera and Raúl Borreguero.

This title belongs to the horror genre. It take as main theme the bullying and harassment of a girl who decides to commit suicide by constant aggression.

She decides to take revenge on thos who harmed in life. Are you ready to deal with someone's death?

Source: The Developer Website.

207227.name: KILL
207227.description:
User Summary

KILL is a survival - action game with sandbox and RPG elements.

207228.name: GunWorld 2
207228.description: GunWorld 2 is the sequel for the action platformed game GunWorld.

207229.name: PANIC at Multiverse High!
207229.description:
When you wake up disoriented and barely knowing your name and nearly late for high school and then threatened by a weird tentacle guy in a letterman jacket - what's a hero to do?

BECOME THE COOLEST PERSON AT MULTIVERSE HIGH, OF COURSE!

Join the cast of Panic in the Multiverse! in their visual novel debut, as you join weird clubs, experience insane classes, celebrate bizarre holidays, and befriend wildly different potential best pals in your quest to tell your rival Chad that he is a massive jerk.

Source: The Game Website.

207230.description:
Description from the publisher:

Thunder in the Ozarks is a two-player wargame about The Battle of Pea Ridge, which was a critical engagement in the American Civil War fought on March 8th and 9th, 1862 between the Confederate Army of the West under Major General Earl Van Dorn and the Federal Army of the Southwest under Brigadier General Samuel Curtis.

In the winter of 1861, the Confederate army in Missouri, then commanded by Major General Sterling Price, had been chased back into the Boston Mountains of Arkansas. The first drive on St. Louis had been repulsed and Van Dorn was summoned to take command of the force and launch a new offensive into the heart of Missouri. Van Dorn, an Indian-fighting cavalryman by trade, arrived at the Rebel camp and even though he was quite ill (due to a fall into a river) he immediately roused the troops. He proposed to launch an immediate attack, despite the freezing weather and fatigued state of his troops. Van Dorn force-marched the army north and managed to pull off a classic Napoleonic stratagem - the “maneuver sur la derrieres”. He placed his army astride the line of communications of his enemy and by any normal military measure this should have been settled the issue for the two armies. But by doing so at such an ill-advised time and at such an inhuman pace the Rebel troops were little more than a frozen and exhausted armed mob when they finally reached their positions.
Brig. General Sam Curtis was not a man to be intimidated and he realized that he had a fighting chance, even in this seemingly impossible position. Perseverance and hard, smart fighting by men like Colonel Grenville Dodge and others turned what looked to be a potential disaster into a grand victory. The Battle of Pea Ridge secured for the Union all of Missouri and the northern part of Arkansas, resulting in approximately 85,000 square miles becoming Federal-controlled territory.

This is the second game in the Revolution Games/GMT series of American Civil War games. The first game, Stonewall’s Sword simulates the Battle of Cedar Mountain in 1862.
207230.name: Thunder in the Ozarks

207231.description:
Tallinn: The Assembly consists of twelve small figures, four each in red, yellow and blue. If you trigger a contest during the round, after resolving those contests you can take a small figure from the supply that doesn't match the faction in which you triggered a contest.

These small figures have no effect during the game, but at the end of the game, each small figure counts as an additional symbol for the matching faction during the final faction row contests.
207231.name: Tallinn: The Assembly

207232.name: Celebrity Name Game
207232.description:
Home version of the popular TV game show hosted by Craig Ferguson. Players have to give clues to get their teammates to say the names of celebrities, characters, famous places, etc. before time runs out. Whichever teams has the most points after four rounds wins!

The show itself was based on the board game called !dentity Crisis? (Identity Crisis?) created by Laura Robinson.

207235.name: Granblue Fantasy Project Re:LINK
207235.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

Granblue Fantasy Project Re: Link features music by Nobuo Uematsu and character designs by Hideo Minaba. The producer is Koichi Haruta and director Tetsuya Fukuhara of Cygames.

207236.name: The Nightmare Invader
207236.description:
In The Nightmare Invader you play as an ordinary hotel guest with an extraordinary ability - you can enter other people's dreams. You will need that power to fight The Nightmare Invader - an evil entity who is trying to take control of all the guests by giving them terrifying nightmares.

To win the game, first you must wake up as many guests as you can before the invader drives them insane with terror. Then you will take the fight to the invader, trying to drive it out of the mind of its human host, or destroying it completely. But it will not be easy. The invader is completely alien, and uses deckbuilding to achieve its goals. Meanwhile you must use six sided dice to achieve yours.

The Invader gets the first turn. On the Invader turn you draw 3 cards from the Invader deck, each showing a different fear, such as Ghosts or Spiders. Any guests afraid of these fears become panicked. If the Invader can panic a guest 5 times before you wake them, they succumb to the will of the Invader and their card is added to the Invader deck, making it stronger.

On your turn, you roll 6 dice. Each die can be used once. If a die roll is high enough, you can use it to calm down a guest and if you calm the guest completely, they wake up and are removed from play. Dice can also be used to learn extra skills and abilities, such as removing the Invader's health, or adding distractions to the Invader deck.

It's a battle of dice versus cards. Do you have what it takes to save humanity and defeat The Nightmare Invader?

207237.name: The Call of the Crystal
207237.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure is a sequel to The Crystal of Juiblex 1: Kobold Tea Party. The kobolds have temporarily found a new home in an abandoned Drow crypt and embalming center. Unfortunately for the kobolds, the area is fraught with danger and they are being pursued by the intrepid players. Little do both parties know, but the true danger lies in the crystal pilfered from Onson's manor.

The Call of the Crystal is the second part of a 6-part adventure series designed to take characters from 1st through 4th level. This adventure also can be used as a standalone adventure.

207238.name: Pathways (Issue 58 - Aug 2016)
rpgissuearticle: 20 Things to Loot from a Dead Kobold
207238.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Armory of Ideas!

How can you say to no to even more FREE Pathfinder content?! Another creature template, 10 strange village traditions, 20 things to LOOT from a dead kobold. Plus, another installment of the path less traveled and much more!

Rite Publishing brings you Pathways, a free 'zine packed with plenty of Open Gaming Content you can bring to nearly any table. You'll find articles by Creighton Broadhurst, David. J Paul, Steven D. Russell, Wendall Roy, and Matt Roth. Plus, an interview with BJ Hensley, the force behind Playground Adventures!

Come over and check out the Pathways Patreon!

A special note. This is the first issue released after the passing of Steven D. Russell, the owner of Rite Publishing and it is unknown if they will continue producing more.

207239.name: Déclic Évolution
207239.description:
Game description from the publisher (translated):
Similar to Trigger!/Déclic!?, Déclic Évolution is a (French) party game testing your reaction and coordination abilities, where all the players have to answer a question as fast as possible using their hands. But the answer is no longer "true" or "false" : each card has its own set of themes, one "blue" and one "yellow". Moreover, 2 additional sets add a third possible answer (to be answered with both hands) : set 2 adds "neither blue nor yellow" and set 3 adds "both blue and yellow".

Game description from the publisher:
Comme dans Déclic ou Déclic Family, les joueurs doivent répondre le plus vite possible avec leur main droite ou leur main gauche en tapant sur la cible au centre de la table !
Mais finies les parties où l'on ne répondait que par VRAI ou FAUX. Désormais, chaque carte dispose de deux thèmes uniques, l'un jaune, l'autre bleu. À chaque nouvelle carte, deux nouveaux thèmes !!!
Chaque partie se déroule en trois manches distinctes :
Manche 1 : avec les cartes vertes, répondez par jaune ou bleu.Manche 2 : avec les cartes orange, répondez par jaune, ou bleu, ou ni l'un ni l'autre avec les deux mains !Manche 3 : avec les cartes rouges, répondez par jaune, ou bleu, ou les deux avec les deux mains !
Matériel : 132 cartes Evolution (1584 défis), 12 cartes Numéros, 16 Bracelets, 1 cible rouge, les règles du jeu.

207240.name: The Bead Game Box
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 70: Thursday, September 29th
207240.description:
The Bead Game Box is an innovative board game for the modern age. Combined with an online App, it gives you access to more than 100 traditional board games.

The Bead Game Box is all about creativity. You can easily share your variations of well known games using the App or you can even create and share your own games. Users also have access to Print&Play boards for games requiring specific boards.

It doesn't matter if it's Tic-Tac-Toe or The Royal Game of Ur. The Bead Game Box is suited for all kinds of games.

207241.description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards each with a value to be earned by visiting the cities and mountain centres. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. There are also some Spanner cards which can be good or bad.

The tracks between the cities are all coloured but the tracks to the mountain centres are grey - but you can only travel one way - they are dead ends. Flights are an add-on from Vaduz.
There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
207241.name: Liechtenstein (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

207242.description:
Some of the biggest questions in the world of science may be answered by studying quarks, the smallest of particles. The problem with trying to study quarks is that you can’t find just one quark; you need to find them in groups called hadrons, or some other exotic particles, like the Pentaquark.

In Pentaquark, you are trying to give science a little helping hand by collecting the five quarks that form this particle at the detector of a massive particle collider. Move cards you need to the detector, discard others so they may come back as anti-quarks, and try to minimize the number of quarks scattered and lost. If too many cards are removed from the game, the Pentaquark has slipped through undetected once again!
207242.name: Pentaquark
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 64: Wednesday, September 7th

207243.description:
This world used to be a garden full of life; from the flying Vadora to the deep-dwelling Dwarves – but that was before Vesh came. The world has been lost and only one city remains; the oldest city in the world – and the last refuge for all of us. Now... we fight back.

The City of Kings is a cooperative tactical roleplaying board game for 1 - 4 players in which your character is tasked with exploring the hazardous world, trading for vital resources, and battling your enemies whilst uncovering a story of a world imperiled.

You start by choosing one of seven stories, then select your hero, with each of the six heroes featuring twelve unique skills and nine customizable stats that allow you to specialize in attacking, healing, tanking, worker management, or whatever you desire. Aside from your hero, you need to manage your workers, who must gather resources in order to trade for new items and build structures to gain powerful bonuses.

You explore across the Ageless Realms by turning over tiles, discovering resources, side quests, hazards, building sites, traders and creatures as you continue to power up whilst preparing to enter Azure Rise.

At its heart, The City of Kings is a complex puzzle featuring endless strategic battles. Each creature is generated from a pool of spells, characteristics and stats offering over 10,000,000 unique battle situations. There are no dice, damage is persistent, it’s up to you to customize your characters and work together to come up with a strategy to defeat whoever stands in your way.
207243.name: The City of Kings
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 22: FAITH, Airecon and The City of Kings
Episode 23 part 1: Mars, Tsuro and Planetarium
Episode 47 :: Colosseum Review - 1754 Conquest Review

207244.name: The Lapis Observatory
207244.description:
From publisher blurb:

A system neutral, 6 level dungeon, for table top RPGs. Presented as a 28 page, illustrated zine.

Contains 44 rooms, a "big boss monster", 4 plants, 7 monsters, 5 NPC adventurers, and 10 treasure items.

207245.name: High Concept
207245.description:
The game of guessing, guessing and pitching movies

Most box office successes can be described in a single sentence. A perfectly formulated pitch that makes actors and producers alike drool over the opportunity to work with you. It's that magic sentence this game is about!

In High Concept you score points by guessing which movies are associated with what pitch - and you also get to create your own movie pitches with the help of prewritten pitch cards. Winning requires both trivia knowledge and winning pitch rounds.

207246.description:
THE GAME

At the start of the game a moderator hands out a role card to each player, assigning them to either a small team of informed werewolves, who know each others identities, or uninformed villagers, who do not know any player identities. The game then alternates in phases of “night”, in which werewolves agree to covertly kill a villager, and “day", in which villagers debate the identities of the werewolves and vote to kill a suspect. Play continues until all of the werewolves have been killed, or until the werewolves outnumber the villagers.

THE CARDS

There are NO DUPLICATES in the Werewolf House deck of 37 different character cards. Each card features a unique, full color character illustration, so even after dozens of game rounds players will still be discovering new art.

CORE CARDS - The base version of the game can be played by 7-12 people, using 6-10 basic villager cards and 1-2 werewolf cards - all included in the Werewolf House deck.

ADVANCED CARDS - It’s fun to mix it up. Dozens of characters with unique abilities have been carefully curated to add complexity to the gameplay, without burdening the moderator with messy role management tasks.
207246.name: Werewolf House

207247.name: Ritjakten
207247.description:
Ritjakten - A game of drawing and guessing for the whole family.

Adults draw words for everyone to guess, while children instead choose from illustrated cards to copy.

The player that first guesses what's being drawn wins tickets (required to move unhindered on the game board) while the drawer gets to move forward on the circus themed game board. First to the finish line wins the game.

207248.name: Uresia: Grave of Heaven (Deluxe Omnibus)
207248.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Uresia Omnibus Edition contains the complete text of Uresia: Grave of Heaven, along with Caravel, Spider Meat, Coatestown and the Rune Guide, along with a combined Master Index. This spiffy hardcover version is spiffy, and has a cover that is not soft.

207249.name: Uresia Winter Annual (2015)
rpgissuearticle: Bohbár’s Cold Light: Notes on the Mice-Folk of the Crowberry Moors
Mummies: What Are They Good For?
On the Ruins of the Gods And What has Been Discovered Therein
The Heresy of the Fourth Daughter
Three Dead Gods to Swear At (Dead Gods to Blame For When Things Go Wrong)
Uresian Deep Tunes: An Encyclopedia Of Folk Songs
207249.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our inaugural issue includes a dozen new articles to enjoy: On the Ruins of the Gods by Michael Newton, Uresian Deep Tunes by Trevor Romney, The Pool of Arnafoura by Paul Stefko, A Snowmen Underground Railroad by Javier Gaspoz, Unusual Schools of Transformed Magic by Liz Harris, Three Dead Gods to Swear At by Aaron Harris, Morel the Malignant by Greg Fetzer, A Pint-Sized Apothecary by Jon H., The Heresy of the Fourth Daughter by Michael Brewer, Mummies by Dan Suptic, The Hviskra by Larry Bullock, and Bohbár’s Cold Light by S. John Ross.

207250.name: Drought in Sulindal
207250.description:
From publisher blurb:

The small region of Sulindal has been in relative peace for over three centuries. The steadings of the region all worked with each other, one in particular, the dwarves of Smitheim defended the region from the horrors that creep from the depths of the Grytfell mountains. One of such horrors is Ugothos, it appeared long ago emerging from a meteorite that fell on the mountain near the area now known as the Grytt Crater. The dwarves managed to seal it then a few days back another meteorite fell which released Uguthos, the dwarves failed to seal him again and fearing the madness and corrupting Uguthos brought would spread through the water, they closed the dams they controlled which gave water to most of the steadings of the region. Its been now 5 days since the dams were closed and no one knows why. To make things worse, it hasn't rained a single inch either (even when magically induced) and wells are drying out one by one. The adventurers come into the region to investigate what is going on, discover the Uguthos danger, find a way to reseal the creature and save the region (and the world) from succumbing to its corruption.

This product contains A 59 page adventure for Dungeon World with

One primary danger and two optional ones depending on what the characters do.
Four fleshed out steadings, each with their own map
Four dungeons and one optional dungeon. The important dungeons have their own maps
Character options including a new material for weapons and armor, dungeon gear, magic items related to the adventure, and two new types of hirelings

207251.name: Scooby-Doo Fright at the Fun Park
207251.description:
Game description from the publisher:
Jinkies! Can you help the Mystery Inc. gang save the fun park from the spooky ghoul? Whoever figures out where the ghoul is hiding, wins!

Kids will enjoy using the Ticket Cards to make their way around the game board trying to find the ghoul. As they move their favorite Scooby-Doo character mover around the board, they will use the Mystery Decoder to find the answers they need to win the game and save the fun park! They can keep track of all of their clues with the Mini Maps and Wipe-Off Markers.

207252.name: Vile Villains One
207252.description:
From publisher blurb:

Twenty five new villains for your Save the Day Superhero Role Playing Game to unleash fiendish plots and make even the heartiest crime fighter shake with dread.

207253.name: Vile Villains Two
207253.description:
From publisher blurb:

Twenty five new villains for your Save the Day Superhero Role Playing Game to unleash fiendish plots and make even the heartiest crime fighter shake with dread.

207254.name: I Loot the Minion's Body
207254.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventurers are always looting the bodies of their vanquished foes. Often the GM simply reads off the villain’s equipment list and the players move on. In this situation, beyond armour, weapons, magic items and some coin most foes never seem to carry anything of minor interest. This doesn’t help the GM diligently trying to breathe life and verisimilitude into his campaign.

Enter I Loot the Minion’s Body. Within, find three tables packed full of the random things found in a minion’s possession. Use them to enliven the looting in your campaign today!

207255.name: I Loot the Minion's Body
207255.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventurers are always looting the bodies of their vanquished foes. Often the GM simply reads off the villain’s equipment list and the players move on. In this situation, beyond armour, weapons, magic items and some coin most foes never seem to carry anything of minor interest. This doesn’t help the GM diligently trying to breathe life and verisimilitude into his campaign.

Enter I Loot the Minion’s Body. Within, find three tables packed full of the random things found in a minion’s possession. Use them to enliven the looting in your campaign today!

207256.name: Seasoned Flexibility - Three New Archetypes
207256.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue of the Player Paraphernalia presents three new archetypes. The Ruthless Overseer by Derek Blakely presents a rogue archetype that thrives off of the misery of others. The Seasoned Veteran by Nikolai Samarine presents a fighter archetype for a matured warrior. And finally, the Whip Master, another fighter archetype whose preferred weapon is more an extension of himself than anything else. A new whip based feat is also included.

207257.name: A Glorious Death
207257.description:
From publisher blurb:

Find Your Doom in the Frozen Wastes!

South, beyond the Empire’s borders, lies a land trapped in ice and snow, a land where people in whom the blood of giants flows, where strange monsters come boiling up from the depths of the earth, spawned by the ichor of gods. It is a place of violence, struggle, and death. It is also a place where heroes are forged on the anvil of adversity. Now you can take on the role of the mighty jotun and find the destiny the gods have written for you. A Glorious Death examines the frozen wastes, the perils it contains, and the peoples living there. In this sourcebook, you’ll find:

Rules and story information for playing jotun characters.
New expert and master paths including the juggernaut and skald.
An assortment of new spells such as call the great raven and bloody revelation.
A detailed look at the lands of the frozen wastes, covering the Blasted Lands, the Ice Watch Isles, and mysterious Blötland.
New relics and dreadful new creatures like the kraken and the lindorm.
“Kill Them All,” an adventure for master characters.




A Glorious Death pulls back the curtain to reveal a war torn landscape in which people live and die for the amusement of the Dark Gods. This supplement gives you everything you need to bring these lands to life!

207259.name: The Things We Leave Behind
207259.description:
Publisher blurb:

The Things We Leave Behind is an anthology of six modern day scenarios for the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game published by Chaosium, Inc., edited by Jeff Moeller, and written by Brian M. Sammons, Scott Dorward, Simon Brake, Oscar Rios and Jeff Moeller. Art by Davide Como, Dean Engelhardt and Stephanie McAlea.

Taking its inspirational cues from Delta Green, Fargo, Blood Simple, and True Detective, the book takes a mature look at the horror of human nature and its ability to be just as disturbing as anything from the Mythos.

The scenarios deal with unavoidable fates, dark secrets, and seriously bad choices made by the antagonists. As so often is the case, there are no winners when fate has trapped you in a dice game for doom or destiny. As such, please be aware that some of themes are quite mature and are suitable for adult gamers only.

207260.name: Victorious: Victorian Role Playing Adventure in the age of Supermankind
207260.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gaslight street lamps pour fitful illumination through the fog-shrouded streets of Victorian cities. Menacing figures lurk in darkened alleyways. Desperate men with nothing to lose and the determination to take what they can from others plot.

This is an RPG where masked vigilantes pit their fantastic powers against all the evil that settled in the darkened streets of a Victorian past that both was and was not!

Victorious, the newest core game powered by Troll Lord Games' celebrated SIEGE engine, allows you to create a wild assortment of heroes, from the wickedly smart to the inhumanly powerful! Victorious can be scaled to meet adventure with investigators of crime, defenders of society against evil monsters, and even mad scientists foiled by masked superheroes.

Character classes that run the gamut of Fantastic Victoriana, from Contraptionists to Magicians, to Investigators and Mesmerists and more!
A system to create your own unique character.
Details of life in the Victorian era, with emphasis on London and New York City.
Combat in all its forms, and how the Supernatural can impact both melee and missile combat. Carriage chase rules are provided as well as combat from trains to ships to the air.
An individualized magic system as well as rules to use the Castles & Crusades magic spells if desired. Conversions of characters from C&C and Victorious to each other’s rules are a snap and guidelines are given for such.
An introductory adventure where the death of Dr. Henry Jekyll is investigated and is not what it seems.

207261.name: Hunter & Hunter Catalogue
207261.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Catalogue of Extraordinary Items for the Victorious RPG: Armor, Weapons & Ordinance.

A Collection of Items from Adhesive Shoes to magnetic Eyes. Motive Transport that includes the Clockwork Carriage and the Hydraulic Horse.

All this and More. The Hunter & Hunter Catalogue is a Collection of all Manner of Curiosities for All Your Extraordinary Needs!

207262.name: Manifest Destiny
207262.description:
From publisher blurb:

A supplement for the Victorious RPG. From sea to shining sea, the American republic stands paramount despite unhealed wounds of the Civil War, the battles with the remaining Indian tribes, and Segregation that still mars the nation. This book details the United States of the 1880s and 1890s, giving details both historical and fantastical for heroes and heroines who fight for justice in the Great Republic.

207263.name: Night of the Jackals
207263.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new drug is finding its way into pubs and Apothecary shops throughout the East End of London.

This drug, called “M” causes rioting, murder, and worse things. Can your heroes find the source of this maleficent chemical before the city is overrun with carnage?

A Gilded Adventure for levels 2-4

207264.name: Phantasmagoria
207264.description:
From publisher blurb:

A gallery of SuperMankind for the Victorious RPG

The Great and the Good!
Persons of Dubious Intent!
Sceptre
With notes on the composition and inhabitants of Darkmore Prison!.

207265.name: Rules Britannia
207265.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ruling over the oceans and a quarter of the Earth’s surface, the British Empire is unarguably the Superpower of the Nineteenth century. Yet cracks appear in the façade of Anglo-Saxon superiority, and nefarious forces are determined to overthrow Queen Victoria’s realm. Details abound on turn of the century British society, cities, and figures that Victorious heroes and heroines might encounter for good or ill.

207266.name: Expanding Classes
207266.description:
From publisher blurb:

Most everyone wants an edge, an angle that allows them to take that extra step, achieve that extra goal, to surprise the enemy. This angle, in hard fought battles with certain loss, can turn and snatch victory from the jaws of disaster.

Expanding Classes is just that angle. Herein we delve into the 13 standard C&C classes, and the Rune Mark, and unleash the power of multiclassing, enhanced classes and switching classes.

Create new characters that combine the powers of several classes, or breath life into old characters, long used to the campaign trail, by switching classes!

Expand your game with C&C Expanding Classes!

207267.description:
'Among the Stars: Space Farms' is a promotional Special Location card set available at the Artipia Games booth at Spiel 2016.

The card set includes two copies of the Space Farms card.

This item card also serves as a cross-promotional items for the company's upcoming title, Fields of Green.
207267.name: Among the Stars: Space Farms

207268.name: Brindisium Adventures
207268.description:
From publisher blurb:

South of the fabled Darkenfold lies the dry plains of Brindisium here men dwell in the shadow of an Empire, ancient yet reduced. Here legions are fierce, her government controlling, he lands are wild and reckless.

Two High Level Adventures!

In the Prophecy of Balak’ zir an ancient orarcle that heralds the doom of the realm has seemingly come to pass. But things are not as they seem and it is us to the few to unravel the mystery of the end of days!

In Mine! Mine! Mine! local magnates have run afoul of all manner of problems, from competing factions, bandits, monsters and more! It is a race to unravel the many players in this complex tale of strong arms and wicked ways.

207269.name: Fortress of The Three
207269.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enter Dirty Bowbe’s Roadhouse and you’re likely to find more than you bargained for, whether in coin or blood.

Volbroth Bearhair has come looking for his men. Camped along the shores of Lake Ugashtan they had begun the construction of a trading post, but they are gone. When he went to check on them all that remained was a smoking hole in the ground and rumors of a tower now vanished.

Thus people have been disappearing all over the Highlands and no one knows why. War between the dwarves and ogre magi has spilled into the plains, the creatures of Ulgakur have been restless, but nothing explains the vanishing tower, burnt ground and missing people.

Return to the Haunted Highlands and unravel the wild rumors of abduction, slavery and the general madness that always seems to begin at Dirty Bowbe’s Roadhouse!

207270.description:
Fields of Green: Crop Circle is a promotional Location card set available at the Artipia Games booth at Spiel 2016.

The card set includes three copies of the Crop Circle card.

This item card also serves as a cross-promotional item for Artipia's title, Among the Stars.
207270.name: Fields of Green: Crop Circle

207271.name: Mercs: Recon – The Cleaner
207271.description:
The Cleaner is a Kickstarter exclusive add-on figure for the Mercs Recon: Counter Threat or Mercs Recon: Assassination Protocol games.

It consists of:
1x The Cleaner miniature
1x The Cleaner stat card

This can be used to replace an Op-For event in game.

207272.name: Mercs: Recon – CPP-209
207272.description:
CPP-209 is a Kickstarter exclusive add-on for the Mercs:Recon Counter Threat and Mercs: Recon Assination Protocol games.

It consists of:
1x CPP-209 miniature
1x CPP-209 stat card

This can be used to replace an Op-For event in the game.

207273.name: Mercs: Recon – Sgt. Pal & Roy McClane
207273.description:
This is a Kickstarter exclusive add-on for the Mercs:Recon Counter Threat and Mercs:Recon Assassination Protocol games.

This contains:
1x Sgt. Pal miniature
1x Sgt. Pal Stat card
1x Roy McClane miniature
3x Roy McClane Stat cards (variable weapons)

These can be used to replace an Op-For event in the game.

207274.name: Great Shakespearean Deaths: Card-Gayme
207274.description:
A card game depicting various deaths that occur in Shakespeare's work. Each card shows an illustration of a Shakespearean death (illustrated by Chris Riddell) and a number of categories: Speed of Death, Gore & Brutality, Fairness, Piteousness, Dramatic Quality and Last Words. Each category is accompanied by a value from one to ten.

Two to five players are dealt all the cards and hold their hand with only one card visible on top of their deck. The game is played in rounds. The current first player chooses a category. The round winner is the holder of the card that shows the highest value for the chosen category on all the currently visible cards. The round winner adds all the visible cards to their hand and everyone turns over a new card. The winner of the round then chooses the next category. The winner of the game is the first player to hold all of the cards.

207275.name: Mercs: Recon – Assistant to the Regional Manager
207275.description:
This is a Kickstarter exclusive add-on for the Mercs:Recon Counter Threat and Mercs:Recon Assassination Protocol games.

Contains:
1x Assistant to the Regional Manager miniature
1x Assistant to the Regional Manager stat card

This can be used to replace an Op-For event in the game.

207276.name: Watching Grass Grow In VR - The Game
207276.description:
User Summary

A thoughtful and inspired VR game about watching grass grow during the end of the world.

207277.name: Hardware Engineers
207277.description:
User Summary

Hardware Engineers is a simulation game where you have to manage a IT business.

207278.name: Wills and Wonders
207278.description:
User Summary

Wills and Wonders is a turn based strategy game in a fantasy setting.

207279.name: Grey Phobia
207279.description:
Grey Phobia is a Hack and Slash, third person shooter game, which is based on post apocalyptic, sci-fi, comix scenario.

Source: The Developer Website.

207280.name: Duckpocalypse
207280.description:
User Summary

In the future, intelligent robot ducks have become smarter than humans, they took our jobs, and took control of our world!

207281.name: Happy Pong
207281.description:
SEIZURE WARNING! Happy Pong is a psychedelic arcade game with crazy visual effects. Your job is to destroy waves of campers in an onslaught of distortion. Whatever happens, you are in for one wild ride.

Source: The Developer Website.

207282.name: Cat President ~A More Purrfect Union~
207282.description:
https://oharock.wordpress.com/

Find love, in a world where cats run the U.S. government!

207283.name: Veilia
207283.description:
https://www.facebook.com/veiliagame/

Veilia is an exploration adventure game, which focuses on the story of Veilia, a cursed girl who has been separated from her body. It is now your job to help her in her search for her old body as well as the sorcerer that took it from her.

207284.description:
Hewns is a modular boardgame, in which players are competing to mine a planet surface which is created differently by the players every new game. The purpose of the game is to mine more Substract (which is a highly valuable liquid with living sub molecular creatures) than any other player.

Each round, players use bidding drones to bid on Aliens (called Hewns); technologies; scouting advantages; and the first player token. The alien Hewns all have different skill levels and abilities. However, Bidding costs valuable Substract!

When a player has his/ her turn they can enter their Hewns through common entrances onto the board which is made up of Nodes and ravines. The spaces of ravines and nodes can be either big, medium or small and these spaces sizes will restrict certain Hewns from entering, e.g: a medium sized Hewn can enter big and medium spaces, but not small spaces.

When Hewns reach the mines on the board they can choose to mine aggressively or normally. The more aggressive the mining the worse the planet will react to the Hewns and also the faster the game will play out. Players can also attack other Hewns owned by other players but the Substract they have collected will be used up as ammunition for the long range and/or powerful shooting.
207284.name: Hewns

207285.name: Island 359
207285.description:
